title: Insulated container with divider in middle

content.question: An insulated container with a divider in the middle contains two separated gases. Gas 1 is initially at a higher temperature than gas 2. The divider is then removed. Which of the following observations might be made over a period of time as the two gases mix together, and why?

choices.label: Gas 1 remains at a higher temperature than gas 2 because gas 1 started at a higher temperature.
Gas 1 remains at a higher temperature than gas 2 because gas 1 started with a higher kinetic energy.
On average, the molecules of gas 1 lose all of their kinetic energy to the molecules of gas 2 through collisions, resulting in gas 2 eventually having a higher temperature than gas 1.
On average, the molecules of gas 1 lose some of their kinetic energy to the molecules of gas 2 through collisions, resulting in the two gases eventually having the same temperature.

content.answer: On average, the molecules of gas 1 lose some of their kinetic energy to the molecules of gas 2 through collisions, resulting in the two gases eventually having the same temperature.
